Enums/TupleDecodingError.html#/s:12Found.name: missingField
Enums/TupleDecodingError.html#/s:12Found.abstract: We tried to read a field beyond the end of the tuple.

Enums/TupleDecodingError.html#/s:12Found.name: incorrectTypeCode
Enums/TupleDecodingError.html#/s:12Found.abstract: We tried to read a field of a different type than the one

Enums/TupleDecodingError.html#/s:12Found.name: missingUUIDData

Enums/ErrorPredicate.html#/s:12Foundatio.name: retryable
Enums/ErrorPredicate.html#/s:12Foundatio.abstract: Returns true if the error indicates the operations in the transactions should be retried because of transient error.

Enums/ErrorPredicate.html#/s:12Foundatio.name: maybeCommitted

Enums/ErrorPredicate.html#/s:12Foundatio.name: retryableNotCommitted
Enums/ErrorPredicate.html#/s:12Foundatio.abstract: Returns true if the error indicates the transaction has not committed, though in a way that can be retried.

Enums/ConflictRangeType.html#/s:12Founda.name: read

Enums/ConflictRangeType.html#/s:12Founda.name: write
Enums/ConflictRangeType.html#/s:12Founda.abstract: Used to add a write conflict range

Enums/MutationType.html#/s:12FoundationD.name: add
Enums/MutationType.html#/s:12FoundationD.abstract: Performs an addition of little-endian integers. If the existing value in the database is not present or shorter than param, it is first extended to the length of param with zero bytes. If param is shorter than the existing value in the database, the existing value is truncated to match the length of param. The integers to be added must be stored in a little-endian representation. They can be signed in two’s complement representation or unsigned. You can add to an integer at a known offset in the value by prepending the appropriate number of zero bytes to param and padding with zero bytes to match the length of the value. However, this offset technique requires that you know the addition will not cause the integer field within the value to overflow.

Enums/MutationType.html#/s:12FoundationD.name: bitAnd
Enums/MutationType.html#/s:12FoundationD.abstract: Performs a bitwise and operation. If the existing value in the database is not present, then param is stored in the database. If the existing value in the database is shorter than param, it is first extended to the length of param with zero bytes. If param is shorter than the existing value in the database, the existing value is truncated to match the length of param.

Enums/MutationType.html#/s:12FoundationD.name: bitOr
Enums/MutationType.html#/s:12FoundationD.abstract: Performs a bitwise or operation. If the existing value in the database is not present or shorter than param, it is first extended to the length of param with zero bytes. If param is shorter than the existing value in the database, the existing value is truncated to match the length of param.

Enums/MutationType.html#/s:12FoundationD.name: bitXor
Enums/MutationType.html#/s:12FoundationD.abstract: Performs a bitwise xor operation. If the existing value in the database is not present or shorter than param, it is first extended to the length of param with zero bytes. If param is shorter than the existing value in the database, the existing value is truncated to match the length of param.

Enums/MutationType.html#/s:12FoundationD.name: appendIfFits
Enums/MutationType.html#/s:12FoundationD.abstract: Appends param to the end of the existing value already in the database at the given key (or creates the key and sets the value to param if the key is empty). This will only append the value if the final concatenated value size is less than or equal to the maximum value size (i.e., if it fits). WARNING: No error is surfaced back to the user if the final value is too large because the mutation will not be applied until after the transaction has been committed. Therefore, it is only safe to use this mutation type if one can guarantee that one will keep the total value size under the maximum size.

Enums/MutationType.html#/s:12FoundationD.name: max
Enums/MutationType.html#/s:12FoundationD.abstract: Performs a little-endian comparison of byte strings. If the existing value in the database is not present or shorter than param, it is first extended to the length of param with zero bytes. If param is shorter than the existing value in the database, the existing value is truncated to match the length of param. The larger of the two values is then stored in the database.

Enums/MutationType.html#/s:12FoundationD.name: min
Enums/MutationType.html#/s:12FoundationD.abstract: Performs a little-endian comparison of byte strings. If the existing value in the database is not present, then param is stored in the database. If the existing value in the database is shorter than param, it is first extended to the length of param with zero bytes. If param is shorter than the existing value in the database, the existing value is truncated to match the length of param. The smaller of the two values is then stored in the database.

Enums/MutationType.html#/s:12FoundationD.name: setVersionstampedKey
Enums/MutationType.html#/s:12FoundationD.abstract: Transforms key using a versionstamp for the transaction. Sets the transformed key in the database to param. The key is transformed by removing the final four bytes from the key and reading those as a little-Endian 32-bit integer to get a position pos. The 10 bytes of the key from pos to pos + 10 are replaced with the versionstamp of the transaction used. The first byte of the key is position 0. A versionstamp is a 10 byte, unique, monotonically (but not sequentially) increasing value for each committed transaction. The first 8 bytes are the committed version of the database (serialized in big-Endian order). The last 2 bytes are monotonic in the serialization order for transactions. WARNING: At this time, versionstamps are compatible with the Tuple layer only in the Java and Python bindings. Also, note that prior to API version 520, the offset was computed from only the final two bytes rather than the final four bytes.

Enums/MutationType.html#/s:12FoundationD.name: setVersionstampedValue
Enums/MutationType.html#/s:12FoundationD.abstract: Transforms param using a versionstamp for the transaction. Sets the key given to the transformed param. The parameter is transformed by removing the final four bytes from param and reading those as a little-Endian 32-bit integer to get a position pos. The 10 bytes of the parameter from pos to pos + 10 are replaced with the versionstamp of the transaction used. The first byte of the parameter is position 0. A versionstamp is a 10 byte, unique, monotonically (but not sequentially) increasing value for each committed transaction. The first 8 bytes are the committed version of the database (serialized in big-Endian order). The last 2 bytes are monotonic in the serialization order for transactions. WARNING: At this time, versionstamps are compatible with the Tuple layer only in the Java and Python bindings. Also, note that prior to API version 520, the versionstamp was always placed at the beginning of the parameter rather than computing an offset.

Enums/MutationType.html#/s:12FoundationD.name: byteMin
Enums/MutationType.html#/s:12FoundationD.abstract: Performs lexicographic comparison of byte strings. If the existing value in the database is not present, then param is stored. Otherwise the smaller of the two values is then stored in the database.

Enums/MutationType.html#/s:12FoundationD.name: byteMax
Enums/MutationType.html#/s:12FoundationD.abstract: Performs lexicographic comparison of byte strings. If the existing value in the database is not present, then param is stored. Otherwise the larger of the two values is then stored in the database.

Enums/StreamingMode.html#/s:12Foundation.name: wantAll
Enums/StreamingMode.html#/s:12Foundation.abstract: Client intends to consume the entire range and would like it all transferred as early as possible.

Enums/StreamingMode.html#/s:12Foundation.name: iterator
Enums/StreamingMode.html#/s:12Foundation.abstract: The default. The client doesn’t know how much of the range it is likely to used and wants different performance concerns to be balanced. Only a small portion of data is transferred to the client initially (in order to minimize costs if the client doesn’t read the entire range), and as the caller iterates over more items in the range larger batches will be transferred in order to minimize latency.

Enums/StreamingMode.html#/s:12Foundation.name: exact
Enums/StreamingMode.html#/s:12Foundation.abstract: Infrequently used. The client has passed a specific row limit and wants that many rows delivered in a single batch. Because of iterator operation in client drivers make request batches transparent to the user, consider WANT_ALL StreamingMode instead. A row limit must be specified if this mode is used.

Enums/StreamingMode.html#/s:12Foundation.name: small
Enums/StreamingMode.html#/s:12Foundation.abstract: Infrequently used. Transfer data in batches small enough to not be much more expensive than reading individual rows, to minimize cost if iteration stops early.

Enums/StreamingMode.html#/s:12Foundation.name: medium
Enums/StreamingMode.html#/s:12Foundation.abstract: Infrequently used. Transfer data in batches sized in between small and large.

Enums/StreamingMode.html#/s:12Foundation.name: large
Enums/StreamingMode.html#/s:12Foundation.abstract: Infrequently used. Transfer data in batches large enough to be, in a high-concurrency environment, nearly as efficient as possible. If the client stops iteration early, some disk and network bandwidth may be wasted. The batch size may still be too small to allow a single client to get high throughput from the database, so if that is what you need consider the SERIAL StreamingMode.

Enums/StreamingMode.html#/s:12Foundation.name: serial
Enums/StreamingMode.html#/s:12Foundation.abstract: Transfer data in batches large enough that an individual client can get reasonable read bandwidth from the database. If the client stops iteration early, considerable disk and network bandwidth may be wasted.

Enums/TransactionOption.html#/s:12Founda.name: causalWriteRisky
Enums/TransactionOption.html#/s:12Founda.abstract: The transaction, if not self-conflicting, may be committed a second time after commit succeeds, in the event of a fault

Enums/TransactionOption.html#/s:12Founda.name: causalReadRisky
Enums/TransactionOption.html#/s:12Founda.abstract: The read version will be committed, and usually will be the latest committed, but might not be the latest committed in the event of a fault or partition

Enums/TransactionOption.html#/s:12Founda.name: causalReadDisable
Enums/TransactionOption.html#/s:12Founda.abstract: Undocumented

Enums/TransactionOption.html#/s:12Founda.name: nextWriteNoWriteConflictRange
Enums/TransactionOption.html#/s:12Founda.abstract: The next write performed on this transaction will not generate a write conflict range. As a result, other transactions which read the key(s) being modified by the next write will not conflict with this transaction. Care needs to be taken when using this option on a transaction that is shared between multiple threads. When setting this option, write conflict ranges will be disabled on the next write operation, regardless of what thread it is on.

Enums/TransactionOption.html#/s:12Founda.name: commitOnFirstProxy
Enums/TransactionOption.html#/s:12Founda.abstract: Committing this transaction will bypass the normal load balancing across proxies and go directly to the specifically nominated ‘first proxy’.

Enums/TransactionOption.html#/s:12Founda.name: checkWritesEnable
Enums/TransactionOption.html#/s:12Founda.abstract: Undocumented

Enums/TransactionOption.html#/s:12Founda.name: readYourWritesDisable
Enums/TransactionOption.html#/s:12Founda.abstract: Reads performed by a transaction will not see any prior mutations that occured in that transaction, instead seeing the value which was in the database at the transaction’s read version. This option may provide a small performance benefit for the client, but also disables a number of client-side optimizations which are beneficial for transactions which tend to read and write the same keys within a single transaction.

Enums/TransactionOption.html#/s:12Founda.name: readAheadDisable
Enums/TransactionOption.html#/s:12Founda.abstract: Undocumented

Enums/TransactionOption.html#/s:12Founda.name: durabilityDatacenter
Enums/TransactionOption.html#/s:12Founda.abstract: Undocumented

Enums/TransactionOption.html#/s:12Founda.name: durabilityRisky
Enums/TransactionOption.html#/s:12Founda.abstract: Undocumented

Enums/TransactionOption.html#/s:12Founda.name: durabilityDevNullIsWebScale
Enums/TransactionOption.html#/s:12Founda.abstract: Undocumented

Enums/TransactionOption.html#/s:12Founda.name: prioritySystemImmediate
Enums/TransactionOption.html#/s:12Founda.abstract: Specifies that this transaction should be treated as highest priority and that lower priority transactions should block behind this one. Use is discouraged outside of low-level tools

Enums/TransactionOption.html#/s:12Founda.name: priorityBatch
Enums/TransactionOption.html#/s:12Founda.abstract: Specifies that this transaction should be treated as low priority and that default priority transactions should be processed first. Useful for doing batch work simultaneously with latency-sensitive work

Enums/TransactionOption.html#/s:12Founda.name: initializeNewDatabase
Enums/TransactionOption.html#/s:12Founda.abstract: This is a write-only transaction which sets the initial configuration. This option is designed for use by database system tools only.

Enums/TransactionOption.html#/s:12Founda.name: accessSystemKeys
Enums/TransactionOption.html#/s:12Founda.abstract: Allows this transaction to read and modify system keys (those that start with the byte 0xFF)

Enums/TransactionOption.html#/s:12Founda.name: readSystemKeys
Enums/TransactionOption.html#/s:12Founda.abstract: Allows this transaction to read system keys (those that start with the byte 0xFF)

Enums/TransactionOption.html#/s:12Founda.name: debugDump
Enums/TransactionOption.html#/s:12Founda.abstract: Undocumented

Enums/TransactionOption.html#/s:12Founda.name: debugRetryLogging
Enums/TransactionOption.html#/s:12Founda.abstract: Undocumented

Enums/TransactionOption.html#/s:12Founda.name: transactionLoggingEnable
Enums/TransactionOption.html#/s:12Founda.abstract: Enables tracing for this transaction and logs results to the client trace logs. Client trace logging must be enabled to get log output.

Enums/TransactionOption.html#/s:12Founda.name: timeout
Enums/TransactionOption.html#/s:12Founda.abstract: Set a timeout in milliseconds which, when elapsed, will cause the transaction automatically to be cancelled. Valid parameter values are [0, INT_MAX]. If set to 0, will disable all timeouts. All pending and any future uses of the transaction will throw an exception. The transaction can be used again after it is reset. Like all transaction options, a timeout must be reset after a call to onError. This behavior allows the user to make the timeout dynamic.

Enums/TransactionOption.html#/s:12Founda.name: retryLimit
Enums/TransactionOption.html#/s:12Founda.abstract: Set a maximum number of retries after which additional calls to onError will throw the most recently seen error code. Valid parameter values are [-1, INT_MAX]. If set to -1, will disable the retry limit. Like all transaction options, the retry limit must be reset after a call to onError. This behavior allows the user to make the retry limit dynamic.

Enums/TransactionOption.html#/s:12Founda.name: maxRetryDelay
Enums/TransactionOption.html#/s:12Founda.abstract: Set the maximum amount of backoff delay incurred in the call to onError if the error is retryable. Defaults to 1000 ms. Valid parameter values are [0, INT_MAX]. Like all transaction options, the maximum retry delay must be reset after a call to onError. If the maximum retry delay is less than the current retry delay of the transaction, then the current retry delay will be clamped to the maximum retry delay.

Enums/TransactionOption.html#/s:12Founda.name: snapshotRywEnable
Enums/TransactionOption.html#/s:12Founda.abstract: Snapshot read operations will see the results of writes done in the same transaction.

Enums/TransactionOption.html#/s:12Founda.name: snapshotRywDisable
Enums/TransactionOption.html#/s:12Founda.abstract: Snapshot read operations will not see the results of writes done in the same transaction.

Enums/TransactionOption.html#/s:12Founda.name: lockAware
Enums/TransactionOption.html#/s:12Founda.abstract: The transaction can read and write to locked databases, and is resposible for checking that it took the lock.

Enums/TransactionOption.html#/s:12Founda.name: usedDuringCommitProtectionDisable
Enums/TransactionOption.html#/s:12Founda.abstract: By default, operations that are performed on a transaction while it is being committed will not only fail themselves, but they will attempt to fail other in-flight operations (such as the commit) as well. This behavior is intended to help developers discover situations where operations could be unintentionally executed after the transaction has been reset. Setting this option removes that protection, causing only the offending operation to fail.

Enums/TransactionOption.html#/s:12Founda.name: readLockAware
Enums/TransactionOption.html#/s:12Founda.abstract: The transaction can read from locked databases.

Enums/DatabaseOption.html#/s:12Foundatio.name: locationCacheSize
Enums/DatabaseOption.html#/s:12Foundatio.abstract: Set the size of the client location cache. Raising this value can boost performance in very large databases where clients access data in a near-random pattern. Defaults to 100000.

Enums/DatabaseOption.html#/s:12Foundatio.name: maxWatches
Enums/DatabaseOption.html#/s:12Foundatio.abstract: Set the maximum number of watches allowed to be outstanding on a database connection. Increasing this number could result in increased resource usage. Reducing this number will not cancel any outstanding watches. Defaults to 10000 and cannot be larger than 1000000.

Enums/DatabaseOption.html#/s:12Foundatio.name: machineId
Enums/DatabaseOption.html#/s:12Foundatio.abstract: Specify the machine ID that was passed to fdbserver processes running on the same machine as this client, for better location-aware load balancing.

Enums/DatabaseOption.html#/s:12Foundatio.name: datacenterId
Enums/DatabaseOption.html#/s:12Foundatio.abstract: Specify the datacenter ID that was passed to fdbserver processes running in the same datacenter as this client, for better location-aware load balancing.

Enums/NetworkOption.html#/s:12Foundation.name: localAddress
Enums/NetworkOption.html#/s:12Foundation.abstract: Undocumented

Enums/NetworkOption.html#/s:12Foundation.name: clusterFile
Enums/NetworkOption.html#/s:12Foundation.abstract: Undocumented

Enums/NetworkOption.html#/s:12Foundation.name: traceEnable
Enums/NetworkOption.html#/s:12Foundation.abstract: Enables trace output to a file in a directory of the clients choosing

Enums/NetworkOption.html#/s:12Foundation.name: traceRollSize
Enums/NetworkOption.html#/s:12Foundation.abstract: Sets the maximum size in bytes of a single trace output file. This value should be in the range [0, INT64_MAX]. If the value is set to 0, there is no limit on individual file size. The default is a maximum size of 10,485,760 bytes.

Enums/NetworkOption.html#/s:12Foundation.name: traceMaxLogsSize
Enums/NetworkOption.html#/s:12Foundation.abstract: Sets the maximum size of all the trace output files put together. This value should be in the range [0, INT64_MAX]. If the value is set to 0, there is no limit on the total size of the files. The default is a maximum size of 104,857,600 bytes. If the default roll size is used, this means that a maximum of 10 trace files will be written at a time.

Enums/NetworkOption.html#/s:12Foundation.name: traceLogGroup
Enums/NetworkOption.html#/s:12Foundation.abstract: Sets the ‘logGroup’ attribute with the specified value for all events in the trace output files. The default log group is ‘default’.

Enums/NetworkOption.html#/s:12Foundation.name: knob
Enums/NetworkOption.html#/s:12Foundation.abstract: Set internal tuning or debugging knobs

Enums/NetworkOption.html#/s:12Foundation.name: tlsPlugin
Enums/NetworkOption.html#/s:12Foundation.abstract: Set the TLS plugin to load. This option, if used, must be set before any other TLS options

Enums/NetworkOption.html#/s:12Foundation.name: tlsCertBytes
Enums/NetworkOption.html#/s:12Foundation.abstract: Set the certificate chain

Enums/NetworkOption.html#/s:12Foundation.name: tlsCertPath
Enums/NetworkOption.html#/s:12Foundation.abstract: Set the file from which to load the certificate chain

Enums/NetworkOption.html#/s:12Foundation.name: tlsKeyBytes
Enums/NetworkOption.html#/s:12Foundation.abstract: Set the private key corresponding to your own certificate

Enums/NetworkOption.html#/s:12Foundation.name: tlsKeyPath
Enums/NetworkOption.html#/s:12Foundation.abstract: Set the file from which to load the private key corresponding to your own certificate

Enums/NetworkOption.html#/s:12Foundation.name: tlsVerifyPeers
Enums/NetworkOption.html#/s:12Foundation.abstract: Set the peer certificate field verification criteria

Enums/NetworkOption.html#/s:12Foundation.name: buggifyEnable
Enums/NetworkOption.html#/s:12Foundation.abstract: Undocumented

Enums/NetworkOption.html#/s:12Foundation.name: buggifyDisable
Enums/NetworkOption.html#/s:12Foundation.abstract: Undocumented

Enums/NetworkOption.html#/s:12Foundation.name: buggifySectionActivatedProbability
Enums/NetworkOption.html#/s:12Foundation.abstract: Set the probability of a BUGGIFY section being active for the current execution. Only applies to code paths first traversed AFTER this option is changed.

Enums/NetworkOption.html#/s:12Foundation.name: buggifySectionFiredProbability
Enums/NetworkOption.html#/s:12Foundation.abstract: Set the probability of an active BUGGIFY section being fired

Enums/NetworkOption.html#/s:12Foundation.name: tlsCaBytes
Enums/NetworkOption.html#/s:12Foundation.abstract: Set the ca bundle

Enums/NetworkOption.html#/s:12Foundation.name: tlsCaPath
Enums/NetworkOption.html#/s:12Foundation.abstract: Set the file from which to load the certificate authority bundle

Enums/NetworkOption.html#/s:12Foundation.name: tlsPassword
Enums/NetworkOption.html#/s:12Foundation.abstract: Set the passphrase for encrypted private key. Password should be set before setting the key for the password to be used.

Enums/NetworkOption.html#/s:12Foundation.name: disableMultiVersionClientApi
Enums/NetworkOption.html#/s:12Foundation.abstract: Disables the multi-version client API and instead uses the local client directly. Must be set before setting up the network.

Enums/NetworkOption.html#/s:12Foundation.name: callbacksOnExternalThreads
Enums/NetworkOption.html#/s:12Foundation.abstract: If set, callbacks from external client libraries can be called from threads created by the FoundationDB client library. Otherwise, callbacks will be called from either the thread used to add the callback or the network thread. Setting this option can improve performance when connected using an external client, but may not be safe to use in all environments. Must be set before setting up the network. WARNING: This feature is considered experimental at this time.

Enums/NetworkOption.html#/s:12Foundation.name: externalClientLibrary
Enums/NetworkOption.html#/s:12Foundation.abstract: Adds an external client library for use by the multi-version client API. Must be set before setting up the network.

Enums/NetworkOption.html#/s:12Foundation.name: externalClientDirectory
Enums/NetworkOption.html#/s:12Foundation.abstract: Searches the specified path for dynamic libraries and adds them to the list of client libraries for use by the multi-version client API. Must be set before setting up the network.

Enums/NetworkOption.html#/s:12Foundation.name: disableLocalClient
Enums/NetworkOption.html#/s:12Foundation.abstract: Prevents connections through the local client, allowing only connections through externally loaded client libraries. Intended primarily for testing.

Enums/NetworkOption.html#/s:12Foundation.name: disableClientStatisticsLogging
Enums/NetworkOption.html#/s:12Foundation.abstract: Disables logging of client statistics, such as sampled transaction activity.

Enums/NetworkOption.html#/s:12Foundation.name: enableSlowTaskProfiling
Enums/NetworkOption.html#/s:12Foundation.abstract: Enables debugging feature to perform slow task profiling. Requires trace logging to be enabled. WARNING: this feature is not recommended for use in production.

Enums/NetworkOption.html#/s:12Foundation.name: supportedClientVersions
Enums/NetworkOption.html#/s:12Foundation.abstract: This option is set automatically to communicate the list of supported clients to the active client.

Enums/NetworkOption.html#/s:12Foundation.name: externalClient
Enums/NetworkOption.html#/s:12Foundation.abstract: This option is set automatically on all clients loaded externally using the multi-version API.

Enums/NetworkOption.html#/s:12Foundation.name: externalClientTransportId
Enums/NetworkOption.html#/s:12Foundation.abstract: This option tells a child on a multiversion client what transport ID to use.

Enums/NetworkOption.html.name: NetworkOption
Enums/NetworkOption.html.abstract: A set of options that can be set globally for the FoundationDB API.

Enums/DatabaseOption.html.name: DatabaseOption
Enums/DatabaseOption.html.abstract: A set of options that can be set on a database.

Enums/TransactionOption.html.name: TransactionOption
Enums/TransactionOption.html.abstract: A set of options that can be set on a transaction.

Enums/StreamingMode.html.name: StreamingMode
Enums/StreamingMode.html.abstract: Options that control the way the binding performs range reads.

Enums/MutationType.html.name: MutationType
Enums/MutationType.html.abstract: A set of operations that can be performed atomically on a database.

Enums/ConflictRangeType.html.name: ConflictRangeType
Enums/ConflictRangeType.html.abstract: Conflict range types used internally by the C API.

Enums/ErrorPredicate.html.name: ErrorPredicate
Enums/ErrorPredicate.html.abstract: Error code predicates for binding writers and non-standard layer implementers.

Classes/InMemoryTransaction.html#/s:12Fo.name: eventLoop
Classes/InMemoryTransaction.html#/s:12Fo.abstract: Undocumented

Classes/InMemoryTransaction.html#/s:12Fo.name: readVersion
Classes/InMemoryTransaction.html#/s:12Fo.abstract: The version of the database that the reads for this transaction start

Classes/InMemoryTransaction.html#/s:12Fo.name: database
Classes/InMemoryTransaction.html#/s:12Fo.abstract: The database we are reading from.

Classes/InMemoryTransaction.html#/s:12Fo.name: committed
Classes/InMemoryTransaction.html#/s:12Fo.abstract: Whether we’ve committed this transaction.

Classes/InMemoryTransaction.html#/s:12Fo.name: cancelled
Classes/InMemoryTransaction.html#/s:12Fo.abstract: Whether we’ve cancelled this transaction.

Classes/InMemoryTransaction.html#/s:12Fo.name: committedVersion
Classes/InMemoryTransaction.html#/s:12Fo.abstract: The version at which we committed this transaction.

Classes/InMemoryTransaction.html#/s:12Fo.name: read(_:snapshot:)
Classes/InMemoryTransaction.html#/s:12Fo.abstract: This method reads a value from the data store.

Classes/InMemoryTransaction.html#/s:12Fo.name: findKey(selector:snapshot:)
Classes/InMemoryTransaction.html#/s:12Fo.abstract: This method finds a key using a key selector.

Classes/InMemoryTransaction.html#/s:12Fo.name: readSelectors(from:to:limit:mode:snapshot:reverse:)
Classes/InMemoryTransaction.html#/s:12Fo.abstract: This method reads a range of values for a range of keys matching two

Classes/InMemoryTransaction.html#/s:12Fo.name: store(key:value:)
Classes/InMemoryTransaction.html#/s:12Fo.abstract: This method adds a change to the transaction.

Classes/InMemoryTransaction.html#/s:12Fo.name: clear(key:)
Classes/InMemoryTransaction.html#/s:12Fo.abstract: This method clears a value in the database.

Classes/InMemoryTransaction.html#/s:12Fo.name: clear(range:)
Classes/InMemoryTransaction.html#/s:12Fo.abstract: This method clears a range of keys in the database.

Classes/InMemoryTransaction.html#/s:12Fo.name: addReadConflict(on:)
Classes/InMemoryTransaction.html#/s:12Fo.abstract: This method adds a read conflict for a key range.

Classes/InMemoryTransaction.html#/s:12Fo.name: addWriteConflict(on:)
Classes/InMemoryTransaction.html#/s:12Fo.abstract: This method adds a range of keys that we want to reserve for writing.

Classes/InMemoryTransaction.html#/s:12Fo.name: getReadVersion()
Classes/InMemoryTransaction.html#/s:12Fo.abstract: This method gets the version of the database that this transaction is

Classes/InMemoryTransaction.html#/s:12Fo.name: setReadVersion(_:)
Classes/InMemoryTransaction.html#/s:12Fo.abstract: This method gets the version of the database that this transaction

Classes/InMemoryTransaction.html#/s:12Fo.name: getCommittedVersion()
Classes/InMemoryTransaction.html#/s:12Fo.abstract: This method gets the version of the database that this transaction

Classes/InMemoryTransaction.html#/s:12Fo.name: reset()
Classes/InMemoryTransaction.html#/s:12Fo.abstract: This method resets the transaction to its initial state.

Classes/InMemoryTransaction.html#/s:12Fo.name: cancel()
Classes/InMemoryTransaction.html#/s:12Fo.abstract: This method cancels the transaction, preventing it from being committed

Classes/InMemoryTransaction.html#/s:12Fo.name: attemptRetry(error:)
Classes/InMemoryTransaction.html#/s:12Fo.abstract: This method attempts to retry a transaction after an error.

Classes/InMemoryTransaction.html#/s:12Fo.name: performAtomicOperation(operation:key:value:)
Classes/InMemoryTransaction.html#/s:12Fo.abstract: This method performs an atomic operation against a key and value.

Classes/InMemoryTransaction.html#/s:12Fo.name: getVersionStamp()
Classes/InMemoryTransaction.html#/s:12Fo.abstract: This method gets a version stamp, which is a key segment containing the

Classes/InMemoryTransaction.html#/s:12Fo.name: setOption(_:value:)
Classes/InMemoryTransaction.html#/s:12Fo.abstract: This method sets an option on the transaction.

Classes/InMemoryDatabaseConnection.html#.name: startTransaction()
Classes/InMemoryDatabaseConnection.html#.abstract: This method starts a transaction on the database.

Classes/InMemoryDatabaseConnection.html#.name: commit(transaction:)
Classes/InMemoryDatabaseConnection.html#.abstract: This method commits a transaction to the database.

Classes/ClusterTransaction.html#/s:12Fou.name: read(_:snapshot:)
Classes/ClusterTransaction.html#/s:12Fou.abstract: This method reads a single value from the database.

Classes/ClusterTransaction.html#/s:12Fou.name: findKey(selector:snapshot:)
Classes/ClusterTransaction.html#/s:12Fou.abstract: This method finds a key using a key selector.

Classes/ClusterTransaction.html#/s:12Fou.name: readSelectors(from:to:limit:mode:snapshot:reverse:)
Classes/ClusterTransaction.html#/s:12Fou.abstract: This method reads a range of values for a range of keys matching two

Classes/ClusterTransaction.html#/s:12Fou.name: store(key:value:)
Classes/ClusterTransaction.html#/s:12Fou.abstract: This method stores a value in the database.

Classes/ClusterTransaction.html#/s:12Fou.name: clear(key:)
Classes/ClusterTransaction.html#/s:12Fou.abstract: This method clears the value for a key in the database.

Classes/ClusterTransaction.html#/s:12Fou.name: clear(range:)
Classes/ClusterTransaction.html#/s:12Fou.abstract: This method clears the value for a range of keys in the database.

Classes/ClusterTransaction.html#/s:12Fou.name: addReadConflict(on:)
Classes/ClusterTransaction.html#/s:12Fou.abstract: This method adds a read conflict for this transaction.

Classes/ClusterTransaction.html#/s:12Fou.name: addWriteConflict(on:)
Classes/ClusterTransaction.html#/s:12Fou.abstract: This method adds a range of keys that we want to reserve for writing.

Classes/ClusterTransaction.html#/s:12Fou.name: getReadVersion()
Classes/ClusterTransaction.html#/s:12Fou.abstract: This method gets the version of the database that this transaction is

Classes/ClusterTransaction.html#/s:12Fou.name: setReadVersion(_:)
Classes/ClusterTransaction.html#/s:12Fou.abstract: This method gets the version of the database that this transaction

Classes/ClusterTransaction.html#/s:12Fou.name: getCommittedVersion()
Classes/ClusterTransaction.html#/s:12Fou.abstract: This method gets the version of the database that this transaction

Classes/ClusterTransaction.html#/s:12Fou.name: attemptRetry(error:)
Classes/ClusterTransaction.html#/s:12Fou.abstract: This method attempts to retry a transaction after an error.

Classes/ClusterTransaction.html#/s:12Fou.name: reset()
Classes/ClusterTransaction.html#/s:12Fou.abstract: This method resets the transaction to its initial state.

Classes/ClusterTransaction.html#/s:12Fou.name: cancel()
Classes/ClusterTransaction.html#/s:12Fou.abstract: This method cancels the transaction, preventing it from being committed

Classes/ClusterTransaction.html#/s:12Fou.name: performAtomicOperation(operation:key:value:)
Classes/ClusterTransaction.html#/s:12Fou.abstract: This method performs an atomic operation against a key and value.

Classes/ClusterTransaction.html#/s:12Fou.name: getVersionStamp()
Classes/ClusterTransaction.html#/s:12Fou.abstract: This method gets a version stamp, which is a key segment containing the

Classes/ClusterTransaction.html#/s:12Fou.name: setOption(_:value:)
Classes/ClusterTransaction.html#/s:12Fou.abstract: This method sets an option on the transaction.

Classes/ClusterDatabaseConnection/FdbApi.name: wrapApiError(_:)
Classes/ClusterDatabaseConnection/FdbApi.abstract: This method wraps around a block that calls an API function that

Classes/ClusterDatabaseConnection/FdbApi.name: FdbApiError
Classes/ClusterDatabaseConnection/FdbApi.abstract: This type wraps an error thrown by the FoundationDB C API.

Classes/ClusterDatabaseConnection.html#/.name: init(fromClusterFile:eventLoop:)
Classes/ClusterDatabaseConnection.html#/.abstract: This method opens a connection to a database cluster.

Classes/ClusterDatabaseConnection.html.name: ClusterDatabaseConnection
Classes/ClusterDatabaseConnection.html.abstract: This class provides a connection to a real database cluster.

Classes/ClusterTransaction.html.name: ClusterTransaction
Classes/ClusterTransaction.html.abstract: This class represents a transaction against a real database cluster.

Classes/InMemoryDatabaseConnection.html.name: InMemoryDatabaseConnection
Classes/InMemoryDatabaseConnection.html.abstract: This class provides a database connection to an in-memory database.

Classes/InMemoryTransaction.html.name: InMemoryTransaction
Classes/InMemoryTransaction.html.abstract: This class represents a transaction for an in-memory database.
